name: George F L Charles Airport
description: The smallest of the two airports.

name: Hewanorra International Airport
description: The larger airport of the two on the island.

name: Diamond Botinical Gardens
description: Explore this magical location where a majestic waterfall stands, one of the most popular tourist attractions on the island. This location is both a historic and naturally beautiful site.

name: Mamiku Gardens
description: This 22-acre garden estate includes the ruins of an 18th-century house and three distinct gardens.

name: Marigot Bay
description: Marigot Bay is located on the western coast of the Caribbean island of Saint Lucia, 3.75 miles southwest from Castries and a short distance from the Saint Lucian National Marine Reserve. It is surrounded on three sides by steep, forested hills.

name: Petit Piton
description: The attraction is ideal if you love hiking and nature trails. This is a to do on everyone's bucket list!

name: Pigeon Island
description: Pigeon Island is a 44-acre islet located in Gros Islet in the northern region of Saint Lucia. Once isolated from the country in the Caribbean Sea, the island was artificially joined to the western coast of mainland in 1972 by a man-made causeway built from dirt excavated to form the Rodney Bay Marina.

name: Rodney Bay
description: Rodney Bay is a bay located in the Gros Islet quarter on the island of Saint Lucia. Gros Islet is one of the ten quarters in the island.

name: Soufriere Drive In Volcano
description:
Soufriere Drive In Volcano

Attraction

Bubbling sulfur springs in the caldera of the dormant Qualibou volcano, with nearby mud baths.

name: Treetop Adventure Park
description: Travel along 12 ziplines through the beautiful rainforest with trained guides giving you information about the nature and wildlife in the rainforest.

name: Vigie Beach
description: Vigie Beach is located 2 km north of Castries, Saint Lucia, running paralle

name: Reduit Beach
description: This beach has more than a mile of fine golden sand with lovely views across the bay to Pigeon Island.

name: Anse Cochon
description: This is located down the west coast of the island, between the CAstries and Soufriere. This has 200 metres of dark sand.

name: Anse Chastanet
description: This beach has 150 metres of dark, silver sand.

name: Balenbouche Estate
description: This family owned Historic Plantation Guesthosue has several vacation cottages. Cottages can sleep between 2 to 6 people, some include kitchens. This destination will make you feel at home.

name: Bay Gardens Beach Resort & Spa
description: Stay at this inviting location to experience true adventure and relaxation.

name: Boucan By Hotel Chocolat
description: Located in the hills near Soufriere, this hotel will stun you with the views of the Piton mountains.

name: Calabash Cove Resort & Spa
description: Nested in the sheltered bay of Bonaire Estate, this hotel is one of just a select few full service, bouquet luxary resorts on the island.

name: Coco Palm Resort
description: This award winning bouquet hotel is the perfect destination if you like classic Carribean French Creole decor.

name: Fond Doux Plantation & Resort
description: If you want a romantic, intimate holiday, this location is the one for you. This has 15 private luxury cottages, two on-site restuarants, and a collage of outdoor swimming pools.

name: Ginger Lily Hotel
description: Escape to this family owned boutique hotel, which is moments away from Reduit Beach.

name: Hummingbird Beach Resort
description: This affordable resort is perfect for nature lovers.

name: Jade Mountain Resort
description: This Resort is the only property with the iconic view of both the Piti and Gros Piton mountains.

name: Ladera Resort
description: Experience St Lucia with this resprt whichs is set at the edge of the rainforest, overlooking both the Carribesn sea and the Piton Mountains.

name: La Haut Resort
description: This hotel sits overlooking Soufriere, one of the oldest towns on the island.

name: Mango Beach Inn
description: This location is ideal if you are curious about history, culture and music as well as rainforest, waterfalls, beaches and nature trails.

name: Big Chef Steakhouse
description:
Big Chef Steakhouse

Resturant

Known for flavour and flair, Big Chef Steakhouse takes the traditional steakhouse to another level of deliciousness, combining the satisfaction of home-cooked comfort food with an innovative, adventurous passion for excellence.

name: Flavours of the Grill
description:
Flavours of the Grill

Resturant

This friendly, modest and colourful little restaurant - the wooden house is painted blue, pink and lime green - is one of the best places on St Lucia to sample authentic, inexpensive Caribbean cooking.

name: Jacques Waterfront Dining
description:
Jacques Waterfront Dining

Resturant

Jacques Waterfront Dining is one of St. Lucia’s most popular restaurants, with a long-standing reputation for consistency in both the quality of the food and the service with which it is delivered.

name: Maries Local Cuisine
description:
Maries Local Cuisine

Resturant

A welcoming restaurant next to the botanical gardens with a quality Creole lunch buffet. Good, hearty meals and a fair price.

name: Masala Bay
description:
Masala Bay

Resturant

Located in Marigot Bay Marina Village at Capella Resort. Serving authentic Indian and Indo Chinese (Hakka) cuisine.
